newsitem.title: ITALY: Bologna airport cargo traffic slips in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Bologna airport cargo traffic slips in 1996.

text.p: Cargo traffic at Bologna's Marconi airport fell 5.9 percent last year to 12,934 tonnes, the managing company of the airport SAB said in its annual traffic data.
This included a dip of 4.0 percent to 8,185 tonnes in cargo moved by air whilst that moved by land slipped 9.2 percent to 1,739.

In contrast the postal sector rose a steep 53.3 percent to 2,959 tonnes. The number of plane movements was also higher rising 20.4 percent to 40,471 as a result of rises of 14.2 percent in scheduled and of 4.6 percent in charter flights respectively.
Passdenger number were up 10 percent from 1995 at 2.21 million.
Overall SAB said the figures fitted into the industry trend offset but "offsetting this phenomonon is the significant inmcrease in thepostal sector."

The drop in cargo movements reflected the decline in Italian manufacturered exports in the second half of last year when the lira rose against other currencies. -- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
